member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.Common.IAudioImp
member.summary: Interface for the Audio implementation. The implementation of this interface is responsible for management of all instances. This is used as a container for all the and handles Sound functions globally.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Common.IAudioImp.OpenDevice
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Opens the device. All derivate instances have to be wiped and the global volume of a Listener(if 3D Sound is intended) can be set to maximum.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Common.IAudioImp.CloseDevice
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Closes the device. All instances of derivate have to be disposed in order to free up memory.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Common.IAudioImp.LoadFile(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Loads the specified file from an external source (examples: hard drive, network, etc) into memory for usage inside of the application.
member.param: Name of the file that should include the file type ending and a absolute or relative path, e.g. C:\sound.ogg .
member.returns: A derivate of should be returned upon successful file path resolution.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Common.IAudioImp.Stop
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Stops all derived playbacks that this instance is responsible for.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Common.IAudioImp.SetVolume(System.Single)
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Sets the global volume of the application. In 3D Sound usually a Listener is used to accomplish this task. In 2D Sound a simple iteration through all derived that this instance is responsible for is sufficient.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Common.IAudioImp.GetVolume
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Gets the global volume of the application. In 3D Sound a Listener is usually used to accomplish this task. In 2D Sound an internal master volume property can be implemented that handles all derived volumes that this instance is responsible for.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Common.IAudioImp.SetPanning(System.Single)
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Sets the panning for all derived that this instance is responsible for.

member.summary: Interface for Mesh implementations. The implementation should handle typical mesh informations like: vertices, triangles, normals, colors, UV's. It is also required to implement a connection to the current RenderContext in order to apply the Mesh for rendering. The Mesh should preferable use handles for its informations in order to communicate with a RenderContext. The handles are referring to so called BufferObjects.

member.summary: Reliable Ordered = 5, Packets don't get lost and are always transmitted in correct order.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.Common.IRenderContextImp
member.summary: The render context interface contains all functions necessary to manipulate the underlying rendering hardware. Use this class' elements to render geometry to the RenderCanvas associated with this context. If you are worked with OpenGL or DirectX before you will find many similarities in this class' methods and properties.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Common.IRenderContextImp.ClearColor
member.summary: The color to use when clearing the color buffer.
member.value: The color value is interpreted as a (Red, Green, Blue, Alpha) quadruple with component values ranging from 0.0f to 1.0f.
member.remarks: This is the color that will be copied to all pixels in the output color buffer when Clear is called on the render context.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.Common.IRenderContextImp.ClearDepth
member.summary: The depth value to use when clearing the color buffer.
member.value: Typically set to the highest possible depth value. Typically ranges between 0 and 1.
member.remarks: This is the depth (z-) value that will be copied to all pixels in the depth (z-) buffer when Clear is called on the render context.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Common.IRenderContextImp.EnableDepthClamp
member.summary: The clipping behavior against the Z position of a vertex can be turned off by activating depth clamping. This is done with glEnable(GL_DEPTH_CLAMP). This will cause the clip-space Z to remain unclipped by the front and rear viewing volume. See: https://www.khronos.org/opengl/wiki/Vertex_Post-Processing#Depth_clamping

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Common.IRenderContextImp.DisableDepthClamp
member.summary: Disables depths clamping.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Common.IRenderContextImp.CreateShaderProgram(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a shader object from vertex shader source code and pixel shader source code.
member.param: A string containing the vertex shader source.
A string containing the geometry shader source.
A string containing the pixel (fragment) shader source code.
member.returns: A shader program object identifying the combination of the given vertex and pixel shader.
member.remarks: Currently only shaders in GLSL (or rather GLSL/ES) source language(s) are supported. The result is already compiled to code executable on the GPU. to activate the result as the current shader used for rendering geometry passed to the RenderContext.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Common.IRenderContextImp.RemoveShader(Fusee.Engine.Common.IShaderHandle)
member.summary: Removes given shader program from GPU

member.summary: Free all allocated gpu memory that belong to a framebuffer object.
member.param: The platform dependent abstraction of the gpu buffer handle.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Common.IRenderContextImp.DeleteRenderBuffer(Fusee.Engine.Common.IBufferHandle)
member.summary: Free all allocated gpu memory belonging to a renderbuffer object.
member.param: The platform dependent abstraction of the gpu buffer handle.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Common.IRenderContextImp.DetachTextureFromFbo(Fusee.Engine.Common.IRenderTarget,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Detaches a texture from the frame buffer object, associated with the given render target.
member.param: Number of the fbo attachment. For example: attachment = 1 will detach the texture currently associated with the ColorAttachment1.
Determines if the texture is a depth texture. In this case the texture currently associated with the DepthAttachment will be detached.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Common.IRenderContextImp.AttacheTextureToFbo(Fusee.Engine.Common.IRenderTarget,System.Boolean,Fusee.Engine.Common.ITextureHandle,System.Int32)
member.summary: Attaches a texture to the frame buffer object, associated with the given render target.
member.param: Number of the fbo attachment. For example: attachment = 1 will attach the texture to the ColorAttachment1.
Determines if the texture is a depth texture. In this case the texture is attached to the DepthAttachment.
The gpu handle of the texture.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Common.IRenderContextImp.GetShaderParamList(Fusee.Engine.Common.IShaderHandle)
member.summary: Get a list of (uniform) shader parameters accessed by the given shader.
member.param: The shader program to query for parameters.
member.returns: A list of shader parameters accessed by the shader code of the given shader program. The parameters listed here are the so-called uniform parameters of the shader (in contrast to the varying parameters). The list contains all uniform parameters that are accessed by either the vertex shader, the pixel shader, or both shaders compiled into the given shader.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Common.IRenderContextImp.GetShaderParam(Fusee.Engine.Common.IShaderHandle,System.String)
member.summary: Returns an identifier for the named (uniform) parameter used in the specified shader program.
member.param: The shader program using the parameter.
member.returns: A handle object to identify the given parameter in subsequent calls to SetShaderParam.
member.remarks: The returned handle can be used to assign values to a (uniform) shader parameter.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.Common.IRenderContextImp.Clear(Fusee.Engine.Common.ClearFlags)
member.summary: Erases the contents of the specified rendering buffers.
member.param: A combination of flags specifying the rendering buffers to clear.
member.remarks: Calling this method erases all contents of the rendering buffers. A typical use case for this method is to erase the contents of the color buffer and the depth buffer (z-buffer) before rendering starts at the beginning of a rendering loop. Thus, rendering the current frame starts with an empty color and z-buffer. for a list of possible buffers to clear. Make sure to use the bitwise or-operator (|) to combine several buffers to clear.

member.summary: Defines how the texture should be sampled when a uv coordinate outside the range of 0 to 1 is given.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.Common.TextureWrapMode.Repeat
member.summary: The integer part of the uv coordinate will be ignored and a repeating pattern is formed.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.Common.TextureWrapMode.MirroredRepeat
member.summary: The texture will be repeated, but it will be mirrored when the integer part of the uv coordinate is odd.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.Common.TextureWrapMode.ClampToEdge
member.summary: The coordinate will simply be clamped between 0 and 1.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.Common.TextureWrapMode.ClampToBorder
member.summary: The coordinates that fall outside the range will be given a specified border color.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.Common.TextureCompareMode
member.summary: Depth textures can be sampled in one of two ways. They can be sampled as a normal texture, which simply retrieves the depth value, this will return a vec4 containing a single floating-point value, or they can be fetched in comparison mode. The result of the comparison depends on the comparison function set in the texture. If the function succeeds, the resulting value is 1.0f; if it fails, it is 0.0f. see: https://www.khronos.org/opengl/wiki/Sampler_Object

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.Common.TextureCompareMode.None
member.summary: Disables the compare mode.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.Common.TextureCompareMode.CompareRefToTexture
member.summary: Enables the compare mode.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.Common.TextureFilterMode
member.summary: Defines how to map texels to uv coordinates.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.Common.TextureFilterMode.Nearest
member.summary: Default texture filtering method. When set, the pixel which center is closest to the texture coordinate is selected.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.Common.TextureFilterMode.Linear
member.summary: Bilinear filtering.An interpolated value from the texture coordinate's neighboring texels, approximating a color between the texels, is taken.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.Common.TextureFilterMode.NearestMipmapNearest
member.summary: Takes the nearest mipmap to match the pixel size and uses nearest neighbor interpolation for texture sampling.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.Common.TextureFilterMode.LinearMipmapNearest
member.summary: Takes the nearest mipmap level and samples using linear interpolation.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.Common.TextureFilterMode.NearestMipmapLinear
member.summary: Linearly interpolates between the two mipmaps that most closely match the size of a pixel and samples via nearest neighbor interpolation.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.Common.TextureFilterMode.LinearMipmapLinear
member.summary: Linearly interpolates between the two closest mipmaps and samples the texture via linear interpolation.

summary.para: Types in this module are used within FUSEE's 3D rendering functionality. Contained interfaces, classes, structs and enums are mostly declarative. Most of these types do not contain methods or other implementation code.
Many data types found in this module are used to glue platform independent code within to underlying platform-specific implementations.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.Common.Cull
member.summary: Specifies if and how triangle culling should be performed. If no culling is specified, triangles are rendered, no matter how they are oriented. Clockwise and Counterclockwise culling refers to in which order a triangle's vertices appear on the screen. If either is specified, triangles in the respective order are culled.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.Common.Blend
member.summary: Used to define the source and destination blending factors. Together, these specify the blend operation to be used when writing a pixel color value onto the render canvas.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.Common.FillMode
member.summary: Specifies the fill mode to use by the rasterizer. Options are Point (renders vertices as single pixels), Wireframe (renders only triangles' edges as lines), or Solid (fills all pixels covered by triangles).
